content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
No permanent structures have been established on the map. Repeated attempts to craft and place a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) were made, but none were successfully deployed. Other facilities used for processing (such as the furnace at (5.0, 5.0) and the copper furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)) were employed temporarily for resource conversion and do not count as map structures.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Incorrect API Usage – get_entities
  – Errors showed an unexpected keyword argument “radius” and later an error stating that 0 positional arguments were expected but 3 were given.
  – Tip: Verify and use the proper function signature for get_entities, ensuring that arguments are passed according to the API specification.

• Lab Placement Failures and Inventory Checks
  – Attempts to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) failed because no Lab was present in inventory.
  – Tip: Confirm that the Lab item is available in inventory before trying to place it on the map.

• Iterating Over a NoneType Collection
  – Filtering lab entities resulted in a “NoneType object is not iterable” error.
  – Tip: Always validate that the returned collection (from functions like get_entities) is not None before proceeding with iteration.

• Lab Crafting Resource Shortages
  – Multiple crafting errors occurred due to missing sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheel, electronic-circuit, and copper-cable) in the lab production chain.
  – Tip: Ensure that all required intermediary components and basic resources are available or producible before initiating lab crafting.
